isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - BLEEDING THE CAB HYDRAULIC SYSTEM

svcproc.title: BLEEDING THE CAB HYDRAULIC SYSTEM

note.para: To operate efficiently and without excessive cab bounce, which may be detrimental to the cab structure, the hydraulic system must have a solid head of fluid (no air in the system). If air in the system is suspected, bleed system as follows.

svcproc.para: Be sure that the pump reservoir is at the proper level. Figure 8shows the location of the reservoir fill screw. Figure 13 and Figure 14 show the ram hydraulic lines.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Cab Lift Ram Hose Connections, Right Side
Figure 14. Cab Lift Ram and Hose Connections, Left Side

step1.para: Turn pump control lever to "RAISE" position and raise cab approximately 2 or 3 feet off the pads.

note.para: Support cab with suitable safety prop.

step1.para: There is a cab hydraulic bleeder screw located on the top of the left side cab latch assembly ( Figure 15). With an assistant, bleed cab hydraulic system as follows.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Left Side Cab Latch (with Bleeder Screw) and Right Side Cab Latch

step1.para: With the pump lever still in the RAISE position, have the assistant pump the handle. While the pump handle is in the downward stroke motion, open the bleeder screw until the pump handle comes to the end of the downward stroke, then close the bleeder screw.
Repeat this procedure for 3 or 4 strokes of the pump then check and fill pump reservoir with fluid.
Repeat steps 2 and 3 until approximately 3 or 4 ounces of fluid have been bled from the system.

svcproc.para: Be sure that the pump reservoir is checked and filled to proper fluid level while bleeding the system.

step1.para: Remove the safety prop. Put pump control lever in DOWN position. Pump cab down. Be sure cab latches lock onto the pads. If latches do not lock automatically, lift the cab latch lever by hand. This action should lock the latch.
Place pump control lever momentarily in the RAISE position and then back to the DOWN position.
Check and fill reservoir to proper fluid level, which is to the bottom of the fill screw hole.
Raise and lower cab to check operation.

note.para: If cab latches do not lock properly, lubricate the latch assembly with engine oil.
